snippet: President U Thein Sein, a once-loyal apparatchik of a brutal military junta, is chipping away at some of its worst legacies.
abstract: Pres U Thein Sein of Myanmar, a once-loyal apparatchik of a brutal military junta, is chipping away at some of its worst legacies; he is freeing political prisoners, partially unshackling the press and allowing the long-persecuted opposition to run for election; why he has evolved from the right-hand man of a much-feared dictator to a campaigner for democratic change is as much a mystery as why the leaders of the former military junta have allowed him to do so.
lead_paragraph: President U Thein Sein, a once-loyal apparatchik of a brutal military junta, is chipping away at some of its worst legacies.

headline.seo: U Thein Sein Begins Transformation in Myanmar
headline.main: As Myanmar Changes, So Does Its Leader
headline.print_headline: As Myanmar Changes, So Does Its Leader
